intro: Psychotria carthagenensis, commonly known as the "Carthagenensis Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It often grows in shaded, moist environments such as tropical forests. Psychotria carthagenensis is also known for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids like dimethyltryptamine (DMT).
